reviews.title: New owners - still a great place to stay!
reviews.text: New owners John and Barbara Maxwell really know the Loire region and are warm and very friendly hosts. A fresh and healthy breakfast was provided and we enjoyed a very pleasant and homey stay for the three nights we were there. The location is very pleasant - in a country village on the river yet close to Loches and nearby most of the great chateaux. John's recommendations for restaurants and touring were accurate and helpful. We recommend you give them a call! ------------

reviews.title: Beware - New Owners!
reviews.text: Andrew & Sue have left. Having visisted several times in previous years and found the atmosphere to be truly wonderful, we booked in again to break our journey coming up from the south of France. Well, what a difference! The new owners are definitely not in the same mould as S & A, so if you are looking for a typically French, laid back and friendly welcome, this may not be the place to go! You have been warned.

Reviews were correct. This is a wonderful place to stay at reasonable prices. My 2 teenage girls were in one room and my husband and I in the other..both with baths. The house is as charming as see in the pictures. The hosts are friendly and fun to talk with. It is a nice base for the castles. The breakfast is great with fresh rolls, yougurt, cereal etc. If it is warm, the river is clean and there is a beach as well. You feel a sense of loss when you leave.
reviews.title: You want to stay forever
Simply delightful
reviews.text: Overall I would say this is probably the best GuestHouse we have ever stayed in. John and Barbara made my son and me very welcome. This is my third visit and can't wait to go back. Close to Tours and indeed Paris by TGV. Plenty of quiet roads for the cycling enthusiasts. Well done to John and Barbara.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 1 night on our way back up to the UK in July.The house sits in the middle of two rivers and is beautifully looked after by John & Barbara. From the moment we arrived they looked after us bringing us afternoon tea and were very friendly without being too much so! This is so difficult to get the balance right but John & Barbara pull it off really well.
reviews.title: Warm welcome in a magnificent location

reviews.title: Beautiful location in Loire Valley

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in July, 2 adults and 2 older teenage boys. We'd heard that Loches was a good base for exploring the Loire and had some great restaurants. Can definitely attest to the former, but never found out the latter, as we ate every night at the Moulin. Barbara is a superb cook, and John a fun and capable host. The (fussy) boys loved everything, and the house was set up perfectly for them, as they had a room of English-language DVDs, books and tourist guides to peruse, their own entrance and the beautiful river Indre to explore. Our room was on the side of the house above the millstream and we were lulled to sleep each night, in one of the most comfortable beds we experienced in our 3 months of travel, to the sound of rushing waters.
reviews.title: Lovely place, wonderful food, great hosts

reviews.text: John has a fabulous selection of wine for non-French-wine-speakers to try, and don't miss the delightful Pineau de Cognac if there's any left.
